messages.subject: Re: leading
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/28/99 5:08:58 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... I agree totally.  Leading is much better than pushing.  After all, if we think it s wrong to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/28/99 5:08:58 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
ECSamHill@... writes:

> My believe is that we need to give people information, and let them draw
> their own conclusions. If we push the conclusions on them, they are more
> likely to fight us in frustration.

I agree totally. Leading is much better than pushing. After all, if we
think it's wrong to push children to learn something, isn't it just as wrong
(and ineffectual) to try to push a parent into homeschooling or unschooling?
(I'm not saying anyone here is trying to do this. It's just a rhetorical
question.)

Elizabeth
